roleset.name: discover a sickness, discovery of illness

example.name: single arg usually illness
example.text: RESEARCHERS diagnosed a genetic defect in a three - day - old mouse embryo in an experiment directly applicable to humans .

propbank.arg: a genetic defect in a three - day - old mouse embryo
in an experiment directly applicable to humans

example.name: semi-predicative illness
example.text: Four workers at GTE Corp. 's headquarters have been diagnosed as having hepatitis , and city health officials are investigating whether a cafeteria worker may have exposed hundreds of other GTE employees to the viral infection , company and city officials said .

propbank.arg: Four workers at GTE Corp. 's headquarters

example.name: ARG2 and ARG0
example.text: Pan explains that in clinical practice , the causes of fever are difficult to quickly diagnose .

example.name: Arg0 and Arg1
example.text: Dr. Jean 's diagnosis of Mr. Bob allowed them to properly treat him for rabies .

example.name: Arg0 and Arg2
example.text: Dr. Jean 's diagnosis of Mr. Bob 's melanoma saved his life .

example.name: What may seem like a tool can be the arg 0, as it tells you what the disease is
example.text: However , the cytology of the cells in the epidermis is nonetheless diagnostic .

propbank.arg: the cytology of the cells in the epidermis

roleset.note: DIAGNOSE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'diagnose' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from diagnose.01-v predicate notes)
DIAGNOSIS-N NOTES: Frame based on diagnose-v.01. Framed by Anwen March 2011 (from diagnosis.01-n)
DIAGNOSTIC-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to diagnose.01. Diagnose.01 is member of vncls characterize-29.2. Framed by Katie. (from diagnostic.01-j)
